Sure! Here are some tips for hiking in Shillong during the trekking season:

1. Prepare for varying weather: You can expect to experience different weathers during hiking in Shillong. It's recommended to bring layers of clothing and waterproof gear to protect you from the rain.

2. Hire a guide: Hiking in Shillong can be challenging due to the rocky terrain, so it's advisable to hire a local guide who knows the area and the trails. They can provide you with information, insights and even help you if anything goes wrong.

3. Carry plenty of water: Staying hydrated is essential for hiking, especially in Shillong where the weather can be humid. Make sure you bring plenty of water and drink regularly throughout the hike.

4. Bring snacks: You’ll likely need some sustenance on your trek, so make sure to bring some snacks with you.

5. Wear the right footwear: The rocky terrain can be rough on your feet. You should wear supportive, comfortable, and appropriate footwear with good treads to avoid slipping on slippery surfaces.

6. Respect the environment: Shillong is a beautiful natural area, so be respectful of the environment and take nothing but memories, leave nothing but footprints.

7. Inform someone: Always inform someone before you begin the hike and inform them about your route, estimated time of arrival, and other details. This is even more crucial if you are alone while hiking. 

I hope these tips help and you have a great time hiking in Shillong!
